clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Information System Regarding the Consumption of Antibiotics and Bacterial Resistance in Primary Care
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Information System Regarding the Consumption of Antibiotics and Bacterial Resistance on the Use of Antibiotics in Primary Care

collaborator.agency: Direction Générale de l'Offre de Soins
CNAMTS, Caisse Nationale d’Assurance Maladie des Travailleurs salariés, France

brief_summary.textblock:
France is a country strong consumer of antibiotics in Europe, specially in primary care.
Outpatient antibiotic use represents around 90% of total antibiotic use and prescriptions come mainly from general practitioners. A literature review of antibiotic stewardship in primary care show that there is no evaluation of interest of giving information about consumption of antibiotics and bacterial resistance to general practitioners. The objective of this study is to demonstrate that practitioners implicated in the followed of consumption of antibiotics and bacterial resistance around their geographical area of practice could change and improve their practices in good use of antibiotics.

primary_outcome.description: Antibiotics consumptions are provided by CNAMTS and calculated in defined daily dose DDD/1000 patient-days around the geographical area concerned by this study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Bacterial resistance of Escherichia coli and Staphylococcus aureus
secondary_outcome.description: The number of intermediate and resistant strains of E.coli and S.aureus are provided by MedQual around the geographical area concerned by this study.

arm_group.description: Physicians will be given informations regarding antibiotic consumptions and bacterial resistance in their activity area every 3 months during 12 months.

intervention.description: Physicians will be given informations regarding antibiotic consumptions and bacterial resistance in their activity area every 3 months during 12 months.

criteria.textblock:

- General practitioners in a "Meurthe-et-Moselle" french department
Exclusion Criteria:
